verbose_text: PKM2 translocation into the nucleus promotes both HIF1 transactivation, leading to GLUT1, PDK1 and LDHA expression, beta-catenin transactivation, leading to cyclin D and c-Myc expression XREF_BIBR, and STAT3 transactivation, leading to MEK5 transcription XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR, which participates in tumorigenesis, tumor growth, the cell cycle and aerobic glycolysis.
